title: Step 33

challengeFiles.name: main
challengeFiles.contents:
text = 'Hello World'
shift = 3
alphabet = 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'

for char in text.lower():
    index = alphabet.find(char)
    print(char, index)
    new_index = index + shift
challengeFiles.seed:
text = 'Hello World'
shift = 3
alphabet = 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'

for char in text.lower():
    index = alphabet.find(char)
    print(char, index)
    new_index = index + shift

tests.text: You should create a new_char variable inside your for loop.
You should set your new_char variable to alphabet[new_index] at the end of your loop body.

description: Now you need to create a new_char variable at the end of your loop body. Set its value to alphabet[new_index].
